text: Abdul Rashid Khan (19 August 1908 â€“ 18 February 2016) was an Indian singer of Hindustani music. He performed khayal, dhrupad, dhamar and thumri. Khan made several musical compositions. He was also a productive writer and poet. For his writing, he used the name Rasan Piya. He trained many students in his lifetime and became regarded as a "guru" at the ITC Sangeet Research Academy in Kolkata. Khan died in 18 February 2016 from multiple organ failure. He was aged 107. ==References== Category:1908 births Category:2016 deaths Category:Indian centenarians Category:Indian musicians Category:Indian singers
title: Abdul Rashid Khan
